summary: This document is an email chain discussing a New York Law Journal article by Bruce Green and Rebecca Roiphe, critiquing Judge Richard Berman's decision to hold a hearing on the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein after his suicide. The article argues the hearing is an inappropriate use of the criminal justice system for victim impact statements when the defendant is deceased and the dismissal is procedurally mandatory.

keyFacts: Judge Richard Berman ordered a hearing on the prosecution's motion to dismiss the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein after his suicide, planning to allow victims to speak.
Legal commentators Bruce Green and Rebecca Roiphe argued this hearing was procedurally odd and inappropriate, as the court has no choice but to dismiss a case upon the defendant's death.
The article states that Epstein's suicide denied the public an accounting for his crimes and left unresolved questions about how he evaded justice previously.
Prosecutors indicated the investigation into Epstein's co-conspirators was ongoing, suggesting future charges were possible.
The email chain shows internal discussion among US Attorney's Office personnel regarding the judge's handling of the case dismissal.
